Actions of the brahmins and householders: Some of the brahmins and householders of Setavyā bowed
Some exchanged greetings and polite conversation
Some held up their joined palms toward Kassapa the Prince
Some announced their name and clan
The friends and colleagues of the chieft: Use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical
Are covetous, malicious, and have wrong view
The method by which the chieftain proves: The chieftain goes to his friends and colleagues who are gravely ill
He tells them about the doctrine of ascetics and brahmins
He asks them to come and tell him if they are reborn in a bad place after death
They don’t come back to tell him or send a messenger
The actions of the chieftain's friends a: Refrain from speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical
Are content, kind-hearted, with right view
The method by which the chieftain proves: The chieftain goes to his friends and colleagues who are gravely ill
He tells them about the doctrine of ascetics and brahmins
He asks them to come and tell him if they are reborn in a good place after death
They don’t come back to tell him or send a messenger
The steps to clean the man who is sunk o: Pull him out of the sewer
Carefully scrape the dung off that man’s body with bamboo scrapers
Carefully scrub that man’s body down with pale clay three times
Smear that man’s body with oil, and carefully wash him down with fine paste three times
Dress that man’s hair and beard
Provide that man with costly garlands, makeup, and clothes
Bring that man up to the stilt longhouse and set him up with the five kinds of sensual stimulation
The things that make humans filthy, stin: The smell of humans reaches the gods even a hundred leagues away
The things that the ascetics and brahmin: Refrain from killing living creatures and so on
Actions performed to see the soul escapi: Lay him on the other side
Strike him with fists, stones, rods, and swords
Actions performed to make the horn speak: Lay the horn on its back
Lay the horn on its side
Lay the horn on its other side
Strike the horn with fists, stones, rods, and swords
Give the horn a good shake
Actions performed by the boy to light th: Chopped the bundle of drill-sticks with the hatchet
Split the bundle of drill-sticks into two, three, four, five, ten, or a hundred parts
Swept them away in a strong wind
The caravan leader's actions [dn23:23.0]: Prepared much grass, wood, and water
Encountered a dark man with red eyes
Asked the man about the desert up ahead
Tossed out the grass, wood, and water
Restarted the caravan with lightly-laden wagons
The consequences of the first caravan le: Saw no grass, wood, or water in the first seven campsites
All men and beasts in the caravan were devoured by a non-human spirit
The caravan leader's actions (second car: Prepared much grass, wood, and water
Encountered a dark man with red eyes
Asked the man about the desert up ahead
Did not toss out the grass, wood, and water
Restarted the caravan with goods laden as before
The consequences of the second caravan l: Saw no grass, wood, or water in the first seven campsites
Saw the other caravan that had come to ruin
Saw the bones of the men and beasts who had been devoured by that non-human spirit
Tossed out any of their merchandise that's of little value and took what's valuable from the other caravan
Crossed over the desert safely, guided by an astute caravan leader.
The things the two friends abandoned and: Abandoned sunn hemp, picked up a bundle of hemp thread
Abandoned the bundle of hemp thread, picked up a bundle of hemp cloth
Abandoned the bundle of hemp cloth, picked up a pile of flax, and by turn, linen thread, linen cloth, silk, silk thread, silk cloth, iron, copper, tin, lead, silver, and gold
